application.doc: Retrieving the current settings for an address

param.name: interface_id
param.doc: ID of the application interface. Valid values are P.1, P.2, P.3, and P.4.

param.name: id
param.doc: A unique identifier that is generated for each address on an application interface. Valid values are 0-98.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieving the current settings for an address
method.doc: To complete this operation with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the application interface addresses resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc:
200 ok
{ "id":"The address identifier", "type":"The address type (ipv4/ipv6)", "enabled":"true/false", "mode4":"static/auto", "netmask":"The IPv4 subnet mask", "prefix":"The IPv6 prefix", "address":"The IP address" }

param.name: type
param.doc: Indicates whether the address is an IPv4 address or an IPv6 address. The value is ipv4 or ipv6.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Indicates whether the address is enabled. The value is true or false.

param.name: mode4
param.doc: Indicates whether the address is static or DHCP-assigned. The value is static or auto. This field is only returned if the address type is ipv4.

param.name: netmask
param.doc: If the mode4 parameter is set to static, this field contains the user specified IPv4 subnet mask. If the mode4 parameter is set to auto, this field contains the DHCP-assigned IPv4 subnet mask. Note: Because there is a lag between configuring an address and DHCP assigning the address value, this field might be empty for auto addresses. This field is only returned if the address type is ipv4.

param.name: prefix
param.doc: This field contains the user-specified IPv6 prefix. This field is only returned if the address type is ipv6.

param.name: address
param.doc: If the type parameter is set to ipv4 and the mode4 parameter is set to static, this field contains the user-specified IPv4 address. If the type parameter is set to ipv4 and the mode4 parameter is set to auto, this field contains the DHCP-assigned IPv4 address. Note: Because there is a lag between configuring an address and DHCP assigning the address value, this field might be empty for auto addresses. If the address type is IPv6, this field contains the user-specified IPv6 address.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.

An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
